### Warnings

* If we say that some property $P$ must hold for $X_p$, where $X_\bullet$ is some simplicial object, then, unless otherwise stated, we **always** mean that $P$ must hold for $X_p$ for **all** $p$

### Simplices

* $\Delta$ is the **simplex category**
    * the objects are the finite ordinals $[n]$;
    * the morphisms the order-preserving maps;
    * we have the **coface** maps $$f_n^i\colon[n-1]\to[n]$$ and **codegeneracy** maps $$s_i^n\colon[n]\to[n-1].$$
* $\Delta[n]:=\Hom_\Delta(-,[n])$ is the **abstract $n$-simplex** and is a **simplicial set**.
* $\Delta^\bullet\colon[n]\mapsto\Delta_\mathrm{Top}^n$ is the collection of **topological simplices** and is a **cosimplicial set**, and we write $\Delta^n:=\Delta^\bullet([n])=\Delta_\mathrm{Top}^n$, where $\Delta_\mathrm{Top}^n\subset\mathbb{R}^{n+1}$ has coordinates $(t_0,\ldots,t_n)$ such that all $t_i$ are non-negative and $\sum_i t_i=1$.
* The coface and codegeneracy maps give us maps on (co)simpicial spaces:
    * **simplicial** spaces $Y_\bullet$ have **face** maps $$\varphi_i^n := Y_\bullet f_n^i\colon Y_n\to Y_{n-1}$$ and **degeneracy** maps $$\sigma_n^i := Y_\bullet s_i^n\colon Y_{n-1}\to Y_n;$$
    * **cosimplicial** spaces $Z^\bullet$ have **coface** maps $$f_n^i := Z_\bullet f_n^i\colon Z_{n-1}\to Z_n$$ and **codegeneracy** maps $$s_i^n := z_\bullet s_i^n\colon Z_n\to Z_{n-1}.$$

### Simplicial sheaves

* **Definition.** A **simplicial sheaf $\mathcal{F}_\bullet$** on a simplicial space $Y_\bullet$ is the data of a collection of sheaves $$\mathcal{F}_\bullet = \left\{\mathcal{F}_p\text{ on }Y_p\right\}$$ together with morphisms $$\mathcal{F}_\bullet\alpha\colon(Y_\bullet\alpha)^*\mathcal{F}_p\to\mathcal{F}_q$$ for all $\alpha\colon[p]\to[q]$ (**n.b.** these are covariant!) such that $\mathcal{F}_\bullet(\beta\circ\alpha)=\mathcal{F}_\bullet(\beta)\circ\mathcal{F}_\bullet(\alpha)$.
* **Definition.** A **simplicial vector bundle** is simply a simplicial sheaf that is locally free at each simplicial level.

### Simplicial forms

* There are a bunch of different (equivalent) definitions, but the idea is that they are forms that are well defined on the fat geometric realisation of a simplicial space.
* **Definition.** The collection of **degree-$r$ simplicial forms** on $Y_\bullet$ is written $\Omega_{Y_\bullet}^r$ and consists of sequence of forms $$\omega_\bullet = \left(\omega_p\in\Omega_{Y_p\times\Delta^p} \mid (Y_\bullet f_p^i\times\id)^*\omega_{p-1} = (\id\times f_p^i)^*\omega_p \in \Omega_{Y_p\times\Delta^{p-1}}\right)_{p\in\mathbb{N}}$$ where $\Omega_{Y_p\times\Delta^q}$ consists of forms that are holomorphic on $Y_p$ and smooth on $\Delta^q$.
* **Definition.** An **endomorphism-valued simplicial form** on a simplicial vector bundle $\mathcal{E}_\bullet$ on $Y_\bullet$ is a sequence of forms
\begin{gather*}
    \left(\omega_p\in\Omega_{Y_p\times\Delta^p}\otimes_{\mathcal{O}_{Y_p}}\mathcal{End}\left(\overline{\mathcal{E}_p}\right)\right)_{p\in\mathbb{N}}\\
    \text{ such that}\\
    \big(\id\otimes \mathcal{E}_\bullet f_p^i\big)\big((Y_\bullet f_p^i\times\id)^*\otimes (Y_\bullet f_p^i)^*\big)\omega_{p-1}\\
    = \big((\id\times f_p^i)^*\otimes\id\big)\omega_p\big(\id\otimes\mathcal{E}_\bullet f_p^i\big)\\
    \in \Omega_{Y_p\times\Delta^{p-1}}\otimes\mathcal{Hom}\left((Y_\bullet f_p^i\times\id)^*\overline{\mathcal{E}_{p-1}},\,\,(\id\times f_p^i)^*\overline{\mathcal{E}_p}\right)
\end{gather*}
where we write $$\overline{\mathcal{E}_q}:=\pi_q^*\mathcal{E}_q=\mathcal{E}_p\otimes_{\mathcal{O}_{Y_p}}\mathcal{O}_{Y_p\times\Delta^p}$$ for $\pi_q\colon Y_q\times\Delta^q\to Y_q$.
* The above condition is really just asking that the form part gives a simplicial form (c.f. [Simplicial conventions](quiver-note-url/C3C5014A-E7C2-4469-8B4C-9FDC60035242)) and that the endomorphism parts agree, i.e. for endomorphisms $A$ on $V$ and $B$ on $W$ and a morphism $f\colon A\to B$ we want that $f\circ A=B\circ f\in\operatorname{Hom}(A,B)$. Compare this to the fact that a morphism $f$ is **flat** if $\nabla_B\circ f - f\circ\nabla_A=0$.
